name: subdued
content:
subdued adjective
(NOT STRONG)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a colour or light is subdued, it is not very bright: subdued lighting
If a noise is subdued, it is not loud: subdued laughter/cheers

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Colourless or causing colour to fade
Silence & quiet
subdued adjective
(MOOD)
If a person is subdued, they are not as happy as usual or they are quieter than usual: He seemed a bit subdued at lunch - is he all right?

Add to word list
Add to word list
(of color or light) not very bright, or (of sound) not very loud: a subdued voice a subdued chalk-stripe suit
A person who is subdued is unusually quiet: Most of the fans were subdued, quietly waiting for the race to start.
